Identify, monitor, track and resolve production related system errors. Elicit requirements using discussions, document analysis, use cases, scenarios, and workflow analysis on small to medium projects. Define and execute test plans on all projects Review data in complex formats. Participate on project teams, understanding project plans, roles, goals and timelines. Qualifications Associates degree or equivalent work experience. 2 to 5 years of related IT experience. Working knowledge for Commercial Insurance. Demonstrate good judgment in what and how to communicate with a variety of clients and achieve results (strong sense of customer service). Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills, preparing written business requirements and test plans that are grammatically correct. Demonstrate organizational skills while working on multiple project initiatives. Demonstrate ability to work effectively with individuals throughout the organization. Exhibit objectivity and openness to others views and contributes to a positive team spirit. Ability to seek guidance or input from mentors and supervisors. Additional Company Details We do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies. Quality Assurance Analyst - job post CorVel Corporation 683 reviews Dallas, TX 75231 • Remote $56,860 - $129,456 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $56,860 - $129,456 a year Job Type Full-time The Quality Assurance Analyst will participate in assigned activities pertaining to planning, coordination, execution and reporting of all test initiatives undertaken to validate the proprietary software applications developed by our Engineering teams. Team responsibilities include: functional testing, regression testing, integration testing, and post release validation. To successfully accomplish these responsibilities, the QA Analyst will work closely with business units and subject matter experts to prepare and execute test cases, manage test data, and identify expected results. Part of the team is based in Portland, OR and part of the team is remote. This position may work from anywhere in the US. Major responsibilities include: Create, execute and maintain test cases for new and changing functionality. Create complex SQL scripts from scratch, in order to manipulate and validate data. Responsible for baseline testing, regression testing, functional/integration testing, and post release validation of application modules as assigned. Rapid testing responses to fixed defects. Identify, document, and communicate defects discovered during testing. Work closely with development team and other QA team members to analyze functionality and to help identify, analyze, and resolve issues. Produce quality products under tight and strict deadlines. Work with Test Automation team to identify and create test cases that will be automated. Required: 3+ years of experience testing applications creating test plans and test cases, executing test cases and managing defects. Strong experience with QA methodologies, software testing techniques and tools, especially for web-based software products. Proven ability to write complex SQL queries from scratch. Experience generating SQL queries including SQL scripts to create or validate testing data - demonstrating a high level of competence and ability. 3+ years’ experience and thorough understanding of relational database design, maintenance, and testing. Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical personnel. Demonstrated analytic, problem solving skills, and technical/non-technical leadership abilities. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience. Bonus Points: Experience with Azure DevOps. Health industry & insurance billing experience. PAY RANGE: CorVel uses a market based approach to pay and our salary ranges may vary depending on your location. Pay rates are established taking into account the following factors: federal, state, and local minimum wage requirements, the geographic location differential, job-related skills, experience, qualifications, internal employee equity, and market conditions. Our ranges may be modified at any time. Pay Range: $56,860 - $129,456 A list of our benefit offerings can be found on our CorVel website: CorVel Careers | Opportunities in Risk Management About CorVel CorVel, a certified Great Place to Work® Company, is a national provider of industry-leading risk management solutions for the workers’ compensation, auto, health and disability management industries. CorVel was founded in 1987 and has been publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock exchange since 1991. Our continual investment in human capital and technology enable us to deliver the most innovative and integrated solutions to our clients. We are a stable and growing company with a strong, supportive culture and plenty of career advancement opportunities. Over 4,000 people working across the United States embrace our core values of Accountability, Commitment, Excellence, Integrity and Teamwork (ACE-IT!). A comprehensive benefits package is available for full-time regular employees and includes Medical (HDHP) w/Pharmacy, Dental, Vision, Long Term Disability, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Account Options, Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance, Pre-paid Legal Insurance, Parking and Transit FSA accounts, 401K, ROTH 401K, and paid time off. The JIT is a collaborative and proactive continuous improvement program sharply focused on preventing product escapes, eliminating production line interruptions, and enhancing value chain performance comprised of cross-functional representatives from Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC), Lockheed Martin Space Systems Company (SSC), and our partnering customers. This position will support the LM JIT continuous improvement strategy which leverages input from internal LM cross-functional peers, external supply chain counterparts, functional and site Quality Assurance management personnel and customer representatives. Superior communication and time management skills are essential. As part of the JIT, you will perform process and product assessments, review requirements, hardware, and documentation to ensure our customer gets the highest level of Quality. In a culture of continuous improvement our department utilizes lean initiatives to reduce waste and drive affordability and efficiency. In this role, you will use quality metrics and business analytics tools to monitor the program’s value chain and provide guidance for recommended support or improvement initiatives. The best candidate for this position ensures the conformance to company and regulatory standards. Initiates, reviews, analyzes and reports on quality-related data/metrics from production, service, supplier or process improvement activities and analyzes using statistical techniques. Interfaces as needed with manufacturing, engineering, customer, vendor and subcontractor representatives to ensure process requirements are met. Basic Qualifications: Minimum of a completed bachelors degree Possess excellent verbal and written communications skills for use at all levels of the organization to track production and/or project status Experience with data analysis Currently possess or ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance. Ability to support travel (25%) as required. Effective interpersonal and communication skills, including team building and collaboration. Desired Skills: Ability to organize and track multiple activities and prioritize task based on importance. Quality experience Ability to review, interpret and apply specifications to determine compliance with requirements. Effective interpersonal skills, including team building and collaboration. Effective communication skills: written, oral, listening, and presentation Experience with Root Cause Analysis tools. Understanding of Lean Six Sigma tools and processes. Basic understanding of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerance). ASQ Certified Quality Associate (CQA), Quality Engineer (CQE), Quality Auditor (CQA) Experience in extracting data, developing charts, and reporting metrics Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings. Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. Quality Assurance Analyst II - job post ARGO Richardson, TX Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time ARGO is a leading provider of software and analytics solutions for both the financial services and healthcare industries. ARGO transforms business processes for financial service providers and healthcare organizations using proven business models and software innovation informed by real customer challenges, breakthrough technology, and rich analytics. The Quality Assurance Analyst II leads, executes, and supports application and system software testing tasks to ensure accuracy, quality and adherence to standards across ARGO’s internal and external SDLC initiatives for our clients. The role entails accountability for providing KPI’s for monitoring processes, enforcing team accountability, and capturing and reporting root cause analytics across the project team for creation of a defect prevention model. The role requires collaboration with both business and technology personnel to comprehend and clarify requirements, formulate comprehensive test strategies, develop input and expected output data, execute and evaluate test results, and support internal and external project testing. This position will be working fully ONSITE at our Richardson, TX location. : QUALIFICATIONS: A Bachelor’s Degree in Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science (CS), or in Liberal Arts with SQA certifications from the ASTQB are recommended for the position. 4+ years of professional experience including 2+ years in software testing. REQUIRED SKILLS: Knowledge of and experience with Quality Assurance and Performance Testing methodologies. Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail. Ability to create and execute simple T-SQL queries to insert and query data with MS SQL Server or other major DBMS. Experience installing and configuring complex software systems on MS Windows that include many client-side and server software components communicating over network and WAN. Experience analyzing log and trace files for test validation and troubleshooting. Excellent time management skills, including dedication and planning to achieve validation of software in order to meet required delivery dates. Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to work in a team environment, as well as work independently with minimum supervision. ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS: Experience with testing techniques such as: pairwise, equivalence partitioning, boundary value analysis, decision tables, cause-effect graphing, state transition testing, defect taxonomies, and other appropriate techniques. Hands on experience using industry standard tools to manage the workflow of testing tasks, such as XRAY or Jira. Experience creating, executing, and modifying automated test execution with testing tools such as Cucumber, Selenium, Ready! API, soapUI Pro, Postman, or other common industry tools. Experience designing and executing controlled performance testing for internal and customer use. Knowledge of Cloud computing services such as Azure (preferred) or AWS. Ability to review and interpret source code (c, c++, c#) to help guide test plans. Knowledge and experience of financial services or healthcare industry software applications. EXPECTED WORK AND PERFORMANCE: The Quality Assurance Analyst will be responsible for the core activities of the testing effort. Job duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned as needed. Knowledge of the value of ARGO’s quality services to increase revenue and deliver value to our customers. Facilitate testing activities to reduce risk, eliminate waste, discover defects, increase confidence in the quality of ARGO software and provide information for project and product decision makers. Conduct test coverage improvements and improve efficiency by leading continuous enhancements to the ARGO test case library using specification-based, defect-based, and experience-based testing techniques. Balance work on multiple projects in various stages simultaneously. Produce test plans, with input from development, product, and project managers, in order to develop and execute test cases that validate the quality of software prior to release to clients. Analyze requirement and design documents for quality, identify gaps and ambiguities, testability, and make recommendations for specification improvement. Acquire knowledge of multiple lines of business and ARGO products. Develop and execute comprehensive test scripts with in depth understanding of data preparation and management to detect defects and execute confirmation tests. Analyze troubleshooting data, and make recommendations on root cause analysis. Acquire knowledge of value and quality from our client’s perspective, and contribute to client testing success, including planning, execution, and problem resolution in UAT and production environments, and effectively communicating results with appropriate parties for resolution. Ability to travel up to 10%. ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Applicants for U.S. or Canadian based positions with ARGO must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available at this time for ARGO positions. Pre-employment background screening will be conducted. Job Summary The KYC Quality Control Analyst is responsible for performing a quality control review of the KYC file submitted by the Onboarding Unit to ensure compliance with the BSA/AML policy. The position reports into the QC Team Lead within the First Line of Defense Control Office and work on Financial Institutions. The QC Analyst is responsible for: Perform Quality Control reviews of Funds customers including CIP, CDD, EDD and SDD Ensure that KYC has been accurately completed in accordance with the quality standards and time frames set within established Policy, Procedures, Standards and Operating manual. Ensure alert and case determination are appropriate, fully supported and clearly documented. Management of QC desktop manuals and procedures Ensure that referrals (from SLoD)/escalation/information requests are properly dispositioned and appropriately documented. This position is typically expected to work a very large number of reviews with little oversight and serves as a Subject Matter Expert for KYC process. May be involved in the interview process for potential candidates for open positions. May receive delegated responsibilities from management. Primary Responsibilities (85%) Perform quality control reviews of KYC files created by Onboarding team to determine if the review and research were conducted in accordance with the quality standards and timeframes set for within established procedures, bank policy and regulatory requirements. Ensures client data, business activity & narrative, products, alerts, documents, extension/exemption and other case determinations are appropriate, fully supported, and clearly documented. Document each review by thoroughly completing a QC Checklist. Demonstrate a detailed understanding of the various computer systems used for performing and documenting the investigations. Communicate concerns with the Onboarding unit and the Team Lead. (5%) Maintains effective working relationships with key business partners. Maintains the ability to provide good customer service. Requires close working relationships with Financial Crime Risk Management business partners. (5%) Assist the Manager/Team Leader with basic duties including case assignments, case reviews and staff training. (5%) Stay abreast of developments concerning BSA/AML/ Sanctions including internal policy, standards, onboarding process and system changes and work with management to ensure the bank remains in compliance. (5%) Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Typically requires a bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 1-3 years of investigative or related work experience with specific emphasis on BSA/AML preferably in the financial services industry. Related professional certifications are highly preferred. Experience reviewing and/or onboarding funds. Thorough knowledge of Foreign Financial Institutions and correspondent banking Sound understanding of high-risk products and services (eg. High-Risk Wires, Trade Finance, etc.) Experience working with Excel – Data entry, Pivot tables, formulas. Etc. Excellent interpersonal skills including superior verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to multi-task, adapt well to changing priorities and effectively prioritize workflow to meet critical deadlines. Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding, and changing environment; must work well under pressure. Expert knowledge of BSA/AML laws and regulations relative to money laundering and terrorist financing and the ability to apply this knowledge in assessing client KYC profiles. Firm understanding of bank products and services especially foreign correspondent banking products and services. The ability and willingness to work independently is required. Must attend and complete Bank-sponsored job-related training. The typical base pay range for this role is between $60,000- $75,000 depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. Job Summary Job Purpose: Under supervision, this role is responsible for performing oversight on essential credentialing functions to attain and maintain quality providers in the dental network. This role also conducts audits for credentialing as well as network data quality. Understands credentialing policies and procedures per NCQA, URAC and CMS standards and other regulatory requirements. Serves as a liaison to delegated entities and vendors to ensure current and adequate credentialing process are in place. Develops and performs queries for data reporting purposes to include directories, ad hoc reports, and network management reports. Responsible for the monitoring and maintenance of credentialing and re-credentialing policies and programs as well as state and federal requirements to ensure compliance is met. The Testing & Monitoring Compliance Analyst is responsible for conducting periodic risk-based compliance reviews to evaluate and test the design and effectiveness of Bank operational compliance with respect to Federal and State regulatory requirements, internal control, Bank policy and departmental procedures. The Testing & Monitoring Compliance Analyst will work closely with the Compliance Officer and other members of the team on the executive of compliance reviews and will act as a liaison with external testing vendors. Essential Functions: Update or create compliance testing plans, data requests, testing spreadsheets, and reports. Perform compliance testing and monitoring and risk assessments as assigned. Review the design and effectiveness of business unit processes and controls, identify risks, and recommend risk-based improvements, as needed, in conjunction with applicable legal and regulatory requirements. Liaison with external testing vendor to provide requested information, schedule needed employee interactions, obtain files and related materials, and review/validate draft and final reports. Collaborate with stakeholders to resolve control weaknesses identified through testing and monitoring. Track/log and review internal and external testing and monitoring findings and remediation methodologies and ensure they meet applicable requirements. Prepare quarterly reports for senior management highlighting the monitoring scope, approach, results, and actions of all testing and monitoring events. Collaborate with compliance department colleagues to identify compliance risks and implement independent monitoring to assess and measure compliance with applicable laws and regulations (including Fair Banking and UDAAP concerns and/or initiatives). Review credit reporting, overdraft and credit dispute processes and controls quarterly and make risk-based recommendations to management. Assist with regulatory examinations as needed. Ensure the bank’s annual disclosures are compliant with laws and regulations. Other ad hoc projects and duties as assigned Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in business or related field OR combination of equivalent relevant work experience and high school diploma, GED, or equivalent required. 2 or more years’ experience in banking compliance OR a banking role with heavy knowledge and experience with compliance regulations (i.e. branch management, lending, etc) required. Direct experience in lending compliance with exposure to Reg Z, TRID, RESPA, etc preferred. Strong working knowledge of Consumer Compliance related laws and regulations, bank operations, and general business financial principles required. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks concurrently. Strong computer skills with proficiency in MS Outlook and Office suite of products required; must have advanced skill level in Microsoft Excel. Experience with related industry systems and software a plus. Sound organizational skills and attention to detail. Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of Bank personnel. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals in, or assigned to, the above position and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required, and may be changed at the discretion of the Company. About the Company: At PlainsCapital, we’ve always had a trailblazing spirit. PlainsCapital was founded in 1988 by Alan White and a group of investors who raised the capital to acquire Plains National Bank, a Lubbock financial institution with one branch and $198.8 million in assets. Alan, who retired from his post as Chairman of PlainsCapital Bank in 2019, partnered with a team of young bankers who dreamed of bringing relationship banking to Lubbock, and they began to grow the bank one relationship at a time. Today, PlainsCapital Bank is one of the largest banks in Texas based on deposit market share. Under the leadership of President and Chief Executive Officer Jerry Schaffner, we have a statewide presence with more than 60 locations in all major Texas markets. We are a strong and stable financial institution and a trusted community partner. We take pride in helping our customers blaze trails of their own, whether launching or expanding a business, raising a family, or moving into retirement. Our diverse range of services includes commercial banking, treasury management, private banking, and wealth management, as well as consumer banking. To learn more, please visit us online at plainscapital.com/about.
